alert.note: Alert for Mercer (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 5:00PM EDT until July 15 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central New Jersey...and northern New Jersey... including the following counties...in central New Jersey...Mercer. In northern New Jersey...Hunterdon, Middlesex, and Somerset. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 500 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... New Brunswick, Somerset, Edison, East Brunswick, South Brunswick, Sayreville, North Brunswick, Ewing, Princeton, Manville, Pennington, and Hopewell. - This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 10 and 12. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 70 and 72. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 11. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 124 and 133. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
